intro: Ornithogalum pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula and parts of southern France. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. Ornithogalum pyrenaicum is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
